item.title: The light in the courtyard of Morland House still out, 10th September
item.description:
The light in this courtyard has not yet been re-lit. In the past the council has responded to requests to fix this. It is an essential part of the security of this yard, especially now that the nights are closing in. We have experienced problems with intruders in this space.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marsham Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped orange chair Barham/Marsham, 10th September
item.description:
Second time reported and chair is still on green in Marsham Close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Barham Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Used needles in the park, 10th September
item.description:
Good evening, I have just returned from walking my dog and thought I'd make you aware of a couple of used needles I spotted. They were at the back in the area with the long grass I have attached a photo of where they are roughly. If it helps they are by an open gate to somebody's back garden. I will report to Lewisham and Bromley council however I know what they'll be like about removing them. My main concern is they will be littered all down the edge in the bushes where children and dogs play.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many potholes on Coniston Close, 10th September
item.description:
There are many shallow potholes and loose gravel on Coniston Close and the whole road needs new tarmac to be relayed urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coniston Close, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped 3 items on Land fronting dry cleaners, 226, Venner Rd, Penge on the corner with Newlands Parade, 10th September
item.description:
Flytipped 3 items on Land fronting dry cleaners, 226, Venner Rd, Penge on the corner with Newlands Parade. I do not know whether this is Council footway land or shop frontage. A green textile recycling bank is also here. The flytip comprises - a white piece of mdf furniture (maybe shelf unit) about 1m x 0.75m x 0.75m - a chair frame - and outdoor folding metal small chair frame
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 210, Venner Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover has trip hazard sticking up, 10th September
item.description:
There is a small item sticking out of the hole cover as shown in the photo which I tripped over, sustaining minor injuries. I am concerned this could cause serious injury to others as it is not very visible. I tried pushing it down into the hole but it pops back up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanstead Road, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet
